metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2492 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in Firebird 2.1.3 through 2.1.5 before 18514,and 2.5.1 through 2.5.3 before 26623, on Windows allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code via a crafted packet to TCP port 3050, related to amissing size check during extraction of a group number from CNCTinformation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firebird2.5-classic - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1
firebird2.5-classic-common - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1
firebird2.5-common - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1
firebird2.5-examples - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1
firebird2.5-server-common - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1
firebird2.5-super - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1
firebird2.5-superclassic - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1
libfbclient2 - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1
libfbembed2.5 - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1
libib-util - 2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firebird2.5 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.2.26540.ds4-8ubuntu1').
